Subject: Obstetrics
Objective: Recognize the classic presentation of ectopic pregnancy including amenorrhea, vaginal bleeding, and unilateral pelvic pain. Understand the role of serum beta-hCG and transvaginal ultrasound in diagnosis.

Subject: Surgery
Objective: Identify the clinical features of acute appendicitis including periumbilical pain migrating to the right lower quadrant, fever, and leukocytosis. Know the appropriate imaging and surgical management.

Subject: Internal Medicine
Objective: Recognize the presentation of acute aortic dissection including sudden tearing chest pain radiating to the back, blood pressure differential between arms, and widened mediastinum on chest X-ray.

Subject: Pediatrics
Objective: Identify the clinical presentation of croup in children including barking cough, inspiratory stridor, and steeple sign on neck X-ray. Understand the use of nebulized epinephrine and dexamethasone.

Subject: Psychiatry
Objective: Understand the symptoms of SSRI discontinuation syndrome including dizziness, nausea, paresthesias, and irritability. Know the management approach of restarting and slowly tapering the medication.
